title: Love Island fans fume as India Reynolds grabs Tommy Fury’s knee in cosy snap
text:
India Reynolds is currently in Paris with Molly-Mae Hague and Tommy Fury (Pictures: PA / Backgrid)

Love Island fans were left shocked when India Reynolds and Ovie Soko split, months after leaving the villa.

And the model has attracted hate from some unimpressed followers after appearing to get a little too close to co-star Tommy Fury, 20.

Yes, seriously.

The pair are currently in Paris with BoohooMan to celebrate Dadju’s new collaboration, joined by Tommy’s girlfriend Molly-Mae Hague and Amber Gill.

In one snap from the trip, they can all be seen posing for a picture while on a night out with Aisha Kamani, wife of Boohoo founder Mahud – as you do.

But eagle-eyed fans were left unhappy when 28-year-old India dared to rest her hand on the boxer’s knee, in an upload shared on her Instagram story.

India dared to put her hand on Tommy’s knee for the snap (Picture: Instagram)

Flocking to the comments below the model’s recent picture, one fumed: ‘How tight do you need to hold on to Tommy’s leg on your story 30/10/19.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

It’s just a leg, hun…

While many, many more were still heartbroken over her relationship with basketballer Ovie coming to an end.

‘I can’t believe you split with Ovie,’ a follower added.

Molly-Mae and Tommy didn’t seem too fussed about it (Picture: Instagram)

However, it doesn’t seem as though Molly-Mae is too fussed about the whole thing, sharing a boomerang of her kissing her beau in front of the Eiffel Tower soon after.

So, that’s that, then.

India and Ovie called time on their relationship (Picture: PA)

It was revealed that Ovie and India split over the weekend, with reports claiming their busy schedules were to blame.

But the chef isn’t taking a backseat from the dating world anytime soon, and is hoping her DMs will get popping.

Speaking at the Pride Of Britain Awards on Monday, she said: ‘Maybe they’ll [DMs] be a bit more full now.

‘I feel like I’ve been dropped back in the ocean. We’ll see. I’m lucky, I’ve got a really close group of girlfriends, they’ve been really looking after me.’

Addressing their break-up, she added: ‘Obviously it’s difficult, but any break-up is difficult.

‘It’s even more difficult when it’s in front of the rest of the world, but I’ll be fine.’
